meanings.definition: Advertised or promoted in a showy or exaggerated manner.
meanings.sent1: The ballyhooed event was full of bright lights and loud music.
meanings.sent2: The ballyhooed movie premiere attracted a large crowd.
meanings.sent3: The ballyhooed circus had more glitter than a treasure chest!
meanings.sent4: Her ballyhooed entrance into the party stole the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The ballyhooed sale promised huge discounts, but the prices were the same.

meanings.definition: To promote or publicize in a showy or exaggerated manner.
meanings.sent1: The company ballyhooed their new product with flashy commercials.
meanings.sent2: The singer's team ballyhooed her upcoming album release on social media.
meanings.sent3: He ballyhooed his cooking skills, but burnt the toast every time!
meanings.sent4: The politician ballyhooed his achievements, but voters saw through the facade.
meanings.sent5: The store ballyhooed their grand opening with a parade and free giveaways.
